research.title: Empowering Democratic Citizenship through Education
research.organization: London School of Economics · Middle East Centre
research.description: Research Assistant — Exploring Rights-Based Approaches to Educational Policymaking in Kuwait.

research.title: Governance of Spatial Change: Shaping Urban Policies in Kuwait
research.organization: London School of Economics · Middle East Centre
research.description: Research Assistant — Exploring the Links between Urban Governance and Spatial Development.

research.title: Neighborhood Tales: Kuwait Under Lockdown
research.description: Research Assistant — A community history initiative examining how residents experienced COVID-19 lockdown conditions in Kuwait, capturing personal narratives through photography and documentation.

training.title: Aswatna: Educating for Inclusion
training.organization: En.v with Data4Change and CTLR at Gulf University for Science and Technology
training.description: Co-designed and facilitated two rounds of ToT for Aswatna: a participatory bilingual program to empower students and teachers to create social change within their schools by using Participatory Action Research methods (2021-2024).

training.title: Enbat: Nurturing Transformational Leadership
training.organization: En.v with BluHat, commissioned by KIPCO as flagship CSR training
training.description: Co-designed and facilitated a ToT for Enbat: an 8 weeks training program for freshly university graduates to cultivate soft skills for work and for life. The program has four modules on: Self, Systems, and Critical Thinking; Cross Cultural Communication; Design Thinking; and Work Culture & Applied Skills (2023-2024).

training.title: Build Ideathon
training.organization: En.v with Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation and Gray Area Collective
training.description: Exploring innovative, user-centric initiatives for vulnerable communities in Kuwait.

training.title: N-mu: Youth Engagement Program
training.organization: En.v with Eurasia Foundation and International Research and Exchange Board
training.description: Exploring concepts of active citizenship and critical skills to create meaningful impact in communities.
